alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Chester; Decatur; Hardin; Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 10:42PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Henderson, southwestern Benton, southern Carroll, northwestern Hardin, northeastern Chester and western Decatur Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1041 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Atwood to 7 miles northwest of Parkers Crossroads to near Lexington to near Jacks Creek. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Henderson, Huntingdon, Natchez Trace State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Parsons, Bruceton, Decaturville, Sardis, Reagan, Blue Goose, Mifflin, Bargerton, Wildersville, Jacks Creek, Parkers Crossroads, Darden, Montgomery, Scotts Hill and Hollow Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Carroll; Chester; Decatur; Hardin; Henderson
